alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued June 08 at 10:30PM PDT until June 09 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE DOUBLE CREEK, NEBO, AND STURGILL BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Double Creek, Nebo, and Sturgill burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Wallowa County. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Double Creek, Nebo, and Sturgill burn scar is expected during the period of the watch. Residents near the Double Creek, Nebo, and Sturgill burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
